page.title: 01FERRYHILL
page.content: The Ferryhill area is typical of many regions in North-East England.The area is now residential-agricultural but was once a centre of mining and heavy industry. In the 1960's the area contained two large collieries at Dean and Chapter (Ferryhill) and Mainsforth and a rail- way marshalling yard at Ferryhill Station.These provided employment for hundreds of people.By 1970 all were closed. Now the only large industry within the region is a limestone-dolomite quarry. There are several small manufacturing companies but they employ few workers and a high unemployment rate is an unfortunate feature of the region.
